description: {"blocks":[{"key":"fkf86","text":"A short guide to primer design with HEX/FAM tags and a basic KASP protocol using LGC Genomics KASP master mix and BioRad analyzation software.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9nc5p","text":"Design regular primers over the mutation you wish to test.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ksuv","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"61olm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"4n8gr","text":"The primer sequence must include this mutation to be specific.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d1teq","text":"Copy and paste the FAM and HEX tags to your wild type and mutant alleles. Pay attention to which tag is which.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fjsb4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8807h","text":"FAM tag: GAAGGTGACCAAGTTCATGCT","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bu2qu","text":"HEX tag: GAAGGTCGGAGTCAACGGATT","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9ll2a","text":"Make primer mix:  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"esgom","text":"      EACH forward primer    18 μl      Reverse primer  45 μl      H2O  69 μl      Total primer mix  150  ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":106}],"data":{}},{"key":"1cah5","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{"0_0":"","0_1":"","2_0":"","2_1":"","4_0":"","4_1":"","6_0":"","6_1":"","A_4":{"className":" "},"B_4":{"className":" "}},"colTitles":["",""],"colWidths":["157","64"],"data":[["EACH forward primer","18 μl"],["Reverse primer","45 μl"],["H2O","69 μl"],["Total primer mix","150"]],"guid":"DB3CF41C7FA711EDA66B0A58A9FEAC02","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":"","mergeCells":{},"printData":[["EACH forward primer","18 μl"],["Reverse primer","45 μl"],["H2O","69 μl"],["Total primer mix","150"]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23]}}}}

  "],["  3  ","  61 C  ","  1 min  "],["  4  ","  Go to step 2   ","  10x  "],["  5  ","  94 C  ","  20 seconds  "],["  6  ","  55 C  ","  1 min  "],["  7  ","  30 C  ","  10 seconds  "],["  8  ","  Go to 5  ","  35x (take read each cycle)  "]],"guid":"5721F58B7FA811EDA66B0A58A9FEAC02","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":"","mergeCells":{},"printData":[["  Step  ","  Temperature  ","  Length  "],["  1  ","  94 C  ","  15 minutes  "],["  2  ","  94 C  ","  20 seconds\u0026nbsp; {"blocks":[{"key":"6k8au","text":"Make sure that each well of the plate has both FAM and HEX fluorophores selected.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dgj7t","text":"On the “Allelic Discrimination” tab the relative florescence units (RFU) for FAM and HEX are displayed, these are used to make a call on the SNP(s) present in each sample.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9hah6","text":"This can be compared to the controls for identification of genotype or species.
